title: Atomic Layer Deposition (ALD) Process
description: A schema representing the steps and parameters involved in setting up and characterizing an Atomic Layer Deposition process and the deposited film.

aldSystem.description: Details about the ALD system used.

aldMethod.description: List of ALD techniques used for each compound deposited for this sample.

compound.description: Name of subcomponent, e.g., InOx, ZnO, GaOx, TiO2.

method.description: ALD method used for this compound. PEALD: Plasma-Enhanced ALD, TALD: Thermal ALD

materialDeposited.description: The material being deposited, e.g., TiO2, Copper.

reactantSelection.description: Selection of precursor and co-reactant based on their reactivity, volatility, and safety.

precursor.description: List of precursors for each compound.

coReactant.description: List of co-reactants used for each compound.

carrierGas.description: Type of carrier gas used in the delivery of reactants.

purgingGas.description: Inert gas used to purge residual precursors and reactants in the chamber.

processParameters.description: Specific parameters under which the ALD process is carried out.

reactor.description: Type and details of the reactor used for the ALD process.

plasmaPower.description: Plasma power (in Watts) if PEALD was used.

substrate.description: The surface where the material was deposited at (e.g., Si wafer, glass, polymer).

deliveryMethod.description: Method of delivering the precursor and co-reactant to the reaction chamber.

temperature.description: The temperature at which deposition occurs, typically in Â°C.

pressure.description: The pressure within the reactor during deposition, typically in Torr.

thicknessControl.description: Control and verification of material thickness per cycle.

growthPerCycle.description: Growth per cycle (GPC) for each compound.

numberofCycles.description: Total number of ALD cycles performed.

saturation.description: Indicates if saturation conditions are achieved during dosing and purging.

nucleationPeriod.description: Initial growth behavior of the film during the first few ALD cycles, measured in cycles.

dosingTime.description: Dosing times per compound for the precursor and the co-reactant.

precursor.description: Time for dosing the precursor, measured in seconds.

coReactant.description: Time for dosing the co-reactant, measured in seconds.

purgeTime.description: Purge times per compound after the precursor and co-reactant dose.

precursor.description: Time for purging the reactor chamber after precursor dosing, measured in seconds.

coReactant.description: Time for purging the reactor chamber after co-reactant dosing, measured in seconds.

flowRates.description: Flow rates of reactants per compound (in sccm).

supercycleDesign.description: Supercycle design used in multicomponent ALD processes. Not applicable for binary processes. Highly affects final film properties.

numberofSubcycles.description: Number of ALD subcycles per compound within the supercycle.

subcycleSequence.description: Sequence of subcycles in the supercycle.

materialProperties.description: Assessment of the properties of the deposited film.

characterizationMethod.description: Method used to determine band gap (e.g., Tauc plot, UV-Vis).

uniformity.description: Assessment of film thickness uniformity across large substrate areas.

variation.description: Permissible variation in film thickness, typically measured in percentage.

conformality.description: Ability of the film to coat 3D structures uniformly.

aspectRatio.description: Aspect ratio of the 3D structures used in testing conformality.

filmComposition.description: Elemental composition data derived from film characterization.

elementalConcentration.description: Measured elemental concentrations, typically reported as atomic percent (at.%) or weight percent (wt.%) depending on the technique.

characterizationMethod.description: Analytical technique used to determine elemental concentration (e.g., XPS, EDS, RBS).

atomicRatio.description: Reported atomic ratios of elements (not to be confused with concentration).

elements.description: Ordered list of element symbols in the ratio (e.g., ['In', 'Ga', 'Zn']).

characterizationMethod.description: Technique used to determine the ratio, if mentioned.

chemicalComposition.description: Chemical composition of the deposited film (e.g., TiO2, Al2O3, InGaZnO).

crystallinity.description: Phase and structural state of the deposited film.

filmDensity.description: Density of the film, typically measured in g/cm3.

deviceProperties.description: Performance metrics of thin-film transistor (TFT) devices that incorporate this deposited material. These reflect device-level characteristics, not intrinsic film properties.

fieldEffectMobility.description: Field-effect mobility (Î¼_FE), extracted from the device's transfer characteristics.

thresholdVoltage.description: Threshold voltage (V_TH). Can be positive or negative depending on the device type.

onOffRatio.description: On/off drain current ratio (I_ON/I_OFF) of the TFT.

deviceStructure.description: Description of the device stack or architecture (e.g., bottom-gate top-contact). Optional but useful for correlating performance.

otherAspects.description: Other important aspects of the ALD process development such as safety and reproducibility.

safety.description: Safety considerations for handling chemicals and reaction products.

filmStability.description: Whether the film remains stable under intended environmental conditions.

reproducibility.description: Consistency of results in repeated experiments.
